Sophie Ristelhueber's coronation at Paris Photo
subhead: Her work is lauded by international critics. Foreign collectors and museums covet her rare prints. Yet, at 76, the French photographer remains a discreet artist in her own country. For 40 years, she has been composing a demanding body of work, giving a new form to places marked by war or history. Honored this year with the prestigious Hasselblad Award, her work is on display at the Grand Palais during Paris Photo.

Cash-strapped France hunts down €10 billion in missing VAT
subhead: The value-added tax is on track to bring in €10 billion less than expected in 2025. The French government has launched an emergency investigation to determine the reasons behind this shortfall, with one prime suspect emerging: small parcels from China.

title: Brother of Marseille anti-drugs figure murdered on street
subhead: Mehdi Kessaci, 20, was the brother of Amine Kessaci, a well-known local figure in the fight against the devastation caused by drug trafficking. He was shot and killed in broad daylight on Thursday.

title: The relentless spiral of speed watching: 'If I don't set it to at least 1.5×, I get bored'
subhead: From TikTok to YouTube, more and more young people are watching videos at increased speeds to consume more content in less time.

title: Vantara, an Indian billionaire's enormous private zoo
subhead: An international report highlights numerous irregularities in the mass transfers of specimens to the private facility in Gujarat, India.

title: Why did the Islamic State group target France?
subhead: Did the terrorist organization target France on November 13, 2015 because of its military operations or the values it represents? The timeline of events and accounts from jihadists reveal a tangle of complex causes.

title: The new life of a former Bataclan hostage
subhead: In December 2015, Marie Hourcastagnou declined to speak to Le Monde when we profiled her husband Arnaud, the last hostage to be freed by the police. Ten years later, she agreed to share her story.
